thread.title: Ronald Koeman handed Everton selection dilemma for Merseyside derby with nervous wait on eight players
thread.title_full: Ronald Koeman handed Everton selection dilemma for Merseyside derby with nervous wait on eight players

author: mirror
title: Ronald Koeman handed Everton selection dilemma for Merseyside derby with nervous wait on eight players
text:
Sport Ronald Koeman handed Everton selection dilemma for Merseyside derby with nervous wait on eight players The Toffees chief will hope his players come home unscathed from international duty with just four days to prepare for Liverpool Share Everton manager Ronald Koeman is sweating on the fitness of eight players (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football   
Ronald Koeman may have to check up on eight players less than four days before his side face Liverpool in the Merseyside derby. 
It will be the Dutchman's first game at Anfield as Everton boss in the 12:30pm kick-off on April 1 with a host of star players set to be assessed upon returning from international duty, report the Liverpool Echo. 
Premier League top scorer Romelu Lukaku plus Kevin Mirallas travel long-haul to Sochi for Belgium's game with 2018 World Cup hosts Russia, though Ramiro Funes Mori and Enner Valencia face the most gruelling journey. 
Funes Mori will tackle the high altitude city of La Paz with Argentina against Bolivia while Enner Valencia is also in World Cup qualifying action for Ecuador at home to Colombia. 
Closer to home, the Republic of Ireland have a home friendly against Iceland with the prospect of both Seamus Coleman and James McCarthy being involved. Romelu Lukaku will travel to Russia to play for Belgium (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp hit with selection dilemma for Merseyside derby with 12 players away on international duty 
Dominic Calvert-Lewin, who netted his first Blues goal on Saturday in the 4-0 win over Hull City plus Ademola Lookman are both in line to be part of the England Under-20s squad who play their final game of a four-team tournament in France on Tuesday night as they take on their Senegalese counterparts in Lillebonne, Normandy. 
Also included are Kieran Dowell and Jonjoe Kenny – both part of David Unsworth’s Under-23s squad – plus Callum Connolly, currently out on loan at Wigan Athletic. 
Another loanee, Gerard Deulofeu who has been farmed out to AC Milan, is part of the Spain squad that plays a friendly in St Denis on Tuesday. Enner Valencia will travel to South America to play for Ecuador (Photo: AFP) Read More
